reviewText:
Can you turn a simple game like Space Invaders into a mess? Yeap, you can. Afterall we are living in a wonderful times in which you can turn every classic into a mess.
Starting the game

Once you start the game you are great by 1280x720 resolution(at least on 1920x1080 monitor) with no option to change... hell there arent many options to change in the game. Do you want Music/Sound Effects/Explosions/Shake Screen on or off. Thats about it . Okay.. maybe the gameplay will be worth it.

Gameplay

So you pick a ship(1 of the 3 avaible ships) and go fight alien ships( I saw 4 kinds of regular ships + 4 kinds mothership). So you fly around firing your cannon/s and blow ships, once they blow up another wave comes greated by robotic" voice. With every wave
date: enemy count increases to the point where you get killed with 1 shot and need to start all over. There is no end level so not much to fight for unless to kill 5 minutes which could be spent in more productive way in other games.\nEvery now and then you will encounter mothership levels which can be hilarious at times. Either ship not moving or heading to ram you with higher speed than your own ship(I wished I had motherships engines). But there is also progression with mothership waves
hoursPlayed:
the more guns it got!!! Hardcore!!!
Now lets stop talking about enemies and see what tools you got to fight against them. 3 ships with questionable design.
Ship N.1 got 1 gun but on the design you can clear see 4. But in the game you shoot a single rocket so why are there 4 visually added guns when only 1 is working? For show off? Oh and should add that its the fastest ship you have(4 out of 5 points; prolly motherships are 5 out of 5)
Ship N.2 got .... wait for it .... 2 guns(when you can see 4 on the ship design) but the issue with it is that those are "flak" guns and good for close combat only which is hell of a fun when you can die from 1 shot . Should add that it cause fps drops like mad once you start shooting. Also .. speed 3 out of 5 points
Ship N.3 the biggest
voteText:
the strongest... the crappiest.  You have 3 guns that you fire in spread so wide than you will rarely hit more than 2 targets at once. And lets not forget speed 2 out of 5!!!
Common thing about all ships is the special weapon : Nuke!!! Which charges up as you hit targets and when used it may or may not hit the ships.
And all this glorious battle happens over a single background image.

Is it worth it?

Nope
votesHelpful:
even when its damn cheap you better save money from not buying 2-3 crappy games and get a good one.

Why my playtime is so low?

Because there is nothing to see else in the game
votesTotal: 5 minutes in you will unlock the 3 ships
votesFunny: play with them to the point where everything is the same and you are done. There are no achievments to earn
commentsCount:
cards to idle or story to follow.

Overall
No... just no."

reviewText:
Was waiting to review until I unlocked the second ship.  So here is an overal review of the game:

PRO's:

PRICE (Well worth it)
The difficulty is well balanced and substantially gets harder after I unlock the second ship.
Love the explosions and variation of the explosion sounds
The background music is enjoyable, but I also love the mute option! haha
Always love when games put in the classic screenshake!
Enjoyed the multiple styles of ships ! I have only played with the first two but the second one is awesome!


CON's:

Lack of configuration options
Would love to see a global leaderboard and not just local


OVERALL

The game was a good fun fast paced shooter based in space with a mix of the classic and newer technologies with good explosions and sfx. Would love to see some more configuration options and more ships! Overall a great buy for a only $0.99!

SUGGESTION

Buy if you like small fun shootemups that will keep you distracted for a couple hours for under $1.00 on sale!

reviewText:
Hey everyone! I saw there were a few negative reviews but since it was only $0.99 on sale I figured I would try it out!

Overall I am pleased with the game and the excitement from blasting alien ships! I have unlocked all three ships and it is much easier to progress through the begnning levels with the third ship since I can get hit 3 times and I shoot 3 bullets in a spreading pattern!

I did have a few bugs that consisted with the settings like another reviewer had. Once they get the settings fixed in terms of working correctly, sometime the music stops and other times it doesn't I would say it would be worth like $2.99!

Overall good game and a great buy if you are looking to have some fun shooting some aliens! what is best is I got it on sale for only $.099!

reviewText:
I often wonder why games that are obviously terrible still somehow get greenlit. Pilot Crusader is another one of those games that a classic formula but doesn't do anything new with it.

Pilot Crusader got the inspiration from games like Space Invaders. Every round you destroy every alien ship without getting hit (that means Gameover). Every 3 rounds you have to battle a mothership and that's it basically.

I wouldn't say the game looks terrible graphic-wise, some of the space ships do look nice but there are only a few different enemies to battle, so things get boring pretty quickly. There are also 3 ships you can choose from, which have a different kind of attack. Somehow the second space ship made my game lag whenever I was shooting....

Overall this game could be fun for 5 minutes if it was free but it's not and I consider this one of the worst Space Shooters out there.

reviewText:
This game at first I was pumped for, but after I played it I found a number of bugs.

Every time you blow up an enemy, there is a giant white box. Bug down.

Sometimes the Mothership doesn't spawn in, and forces you to loose the streak.

There is no way to tell how to unlock more ships.

The AI and Ships in here are simply way too fast and your cannons are weak, and you can get killed with a single hit. Simply not recommended, they have Refunds for a reason.

reviewText: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JK6NmknnNTE\nI can't recommend this game at all, even for the $2 price tag. Hit box detection is bad and causes lots of deaths. The axis in which the ship rotate around constantly moves, so the ships don't always rotate around the center of the ship. Every third level is a boss fight and it's random as to which boss you fight. There are three bosses and their difficulties vary. When you die once, it's game over. No life bar and no extra lives. It's not fun at all. Overall, this feels like a student project for a programming class.
voteText: 5 of 8 people (63%) found this review helpful 2 people found this review funny

reviewText: Collisions are not pixel perfect, so you have to leave extra space to avoid the shots.  Shots are hard to see due to the explosions (yes, it's set to under and I still can't see what's hitting me).  Fast enemies and slow enemies both fire the same shots.  Unlocking the second ship actually made it harder to play since shooting drops the framrate noticeably (why?!  there's hardly anything onscreen?), and you have to shoot at the enemies point blank and they will fire a bullet you can't even see that kills you.  The first ship rotates around it's lower right corner (I think?) rather than it's center, etc., etc.  Too frustrating to play long enough to unlock the third ship.

When you make it to the first boss, be ready to nuke. very stable, and very simple overall. My only gripe is that if your ship is facing the opposite way you are trying to move you hardly move and you end up dying and have to start from the beginning. But its fun and you'll enjoy it!

reviewText:
First impressions so far:

If you're a fan to that certain genre, which I certainly am, Pilot Crusader could be considered as genereally likeable. Be aware though that it still comes with a couple of flaws in it's current version. If you peek into the forums you'll notice that the devs are trying to get rid of those issues but the game isn't very polished by the time I write this review.

Graphics are somewhere between ok and cool, keeping in mind it's an indie I'd say it totally does its job.

Controls, well no Joypad so far, someone should indeed be whipped for that design decision ! SHAME, SHAME,... !
Seriously, the game kinda feels like a very early version of Beat Hazard, basically that is a very good thing ;)

Session Playtime, is delightfully short thus you could play 1 to 3 levels in about 5 minutes of time, something I do prefer.

If the devs manage to add joypad support and cope with the bugs you probably won't do anything wrong by spending 2$ on this.

Regards,
NicoNico
